snippet: The majority of civilians died at the hands of the Taliban and other insurgents whose use of homemade bombs was more prevalent and whose suicide bombers killed more each time.
abstract: Annual United Nations report on civilian casualties finds that a record number of Afghan civilians were killed in 2011, the majority at the hands of the Taliban and other insurgent groups.
lead_paragraph: The majority of civilians died at the hands of the Taliban and other insurgents whose use of homemade bombs was more prevalent and whose suicide bombers killed more each time.

headline.seo: Afghanistan Civilian Deaths Hit Record, U.N. Says
headline.main: Record Number of Afghan Civilians Died in 2011, Mostly in Insurgent Attacks, U.N. Says
headline.print_headline: Record Number of Afghan Civilians Died in 2011, Mostly in Insurgent Attacks, U.N. Says
